name: Russian Spring Punch
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker except the sparkling wine, shake well with ice, strain into a chilled tall tumbler glass filled with ice, and top up with sparkling wine.
description: The Russian Spring Punch was created in London, England by Dick Bradsell in the 1980s. He claims not to remember which bar he was working at at the time, but tells the story of how he created the recipe for personal friends wishing to hold a cocktail party while minimizing the amount of money they had to spend on alcohol. Participants were provided with the vodka, cassis, sugar syrup and lemon juice, and were asked to bring their own sparkling wine. It is named for the russian vodka, and the Tom Collins, which is a spring drink.
garnish: Garnish with blackberries and optionally a lemon slice as well.

ingredients.name: Vodka
ingredients.description:
Vodka is a distilled spirit that is known for its clear and colorless appearance. It is typically produced from the fermentation and distillation of grains, potatoes, or sometimes fruits. The resulting alcohol is then often filtered and diluted with water to achieve the desired alcohol content.

Vodka is characterized by its relatively neutral taste and aroma. It is intentionally distilled to be a clean and pure spirit, allowing it to take on the characteristics of its base ingredients.

ingredients.name: Lemon juice
ingredients.description:
Lemon juice is a versatile and essential ingredient in many cocktails, prized for its bright, tart flavor and ability to balance sweetness. Extracted from fresh lemons, this citrus juice adds a refreshing zing and acidity that can elevate and harmonize other flavors in a drink.

In cocktails, lemon juice serves multiple purposes. It provides a crisp, clean finish. Its high acidity also helps to cut through rich or sweet components, creating a more balanced and complex taste experience.


When using lemon juice in cocktails, freshly squeezed is always preferred over bottled versions for its superior flavor and aroma. The amount used can vary greatly depending on the recipe, but even a small quantity can significantly impact the final taste of a drink.

ingredients.name: Crème de cassis
ingredients.description: Crème de Cassis is a sweet liqueur made from blackcurrants. It has a deep red-purple color and a rich, fruity flavor with a combination of sweetness and tartness. The liqueur is often used as a key ingredient in cocktails, with the Kir and Kir Royale being classic examples. Crème de Cassis can also be enjoyed on its own over ice or used in culinary applications to add a burst of blackcurrant flavor to desserts or sauces.

ingredients.name: Simple Syrup
ingredients.description:
Simple syrup is a basic sweetener used in cocktails, made by dissolving sugar in water. The standard recipe is a 1:1 ratio of sugar to water, although variations exist, such as rich simple syrup, which uses a 2:1 ratio for a thicker, sweeter result. The syrup is clear and easily mixes with both cold and hot liquids, making it an essential ingredient in many drinks.

Simple syrup can also be infused with additional flavors like herbs, spices, or fruits, adding a layer of complexity to cocktails.

ingredients.name: Champagne
ingredients.description:
Champagne is a sparkling wine that comes from the Champagne region of France. It is one of the most famous and prestigious types of sparkling wine globally. The name "Champagne" is legally protected, and only wines produced in the Champagne region using specific methods can be labeled as such.

Champagne is often associated with celebrations and is widely used in toasts. It comes in various styles, including non-vintage (a blend of multiple years), vintage (made from grapes of a single year), and prestige cuvées (high-quality, limited-production wines from a specific producer). The versatility of Champagne allows it to be enjoyed on its own or paired with a variety of foods.
